Ira is a graduate research assistant in the department of Wildlife, Fisheries, and Aquaculture as well as the Animal Dairy Sciences at Mississippi State University. Growing up on the family farm in Northeast Kansas, Ira developed a love and passion for animals, the outdoors and nature. He received his bachelors from Kansas State University in 2015, where he majored in Feed Science and Management. Driven by a desire to learn and pursue a career with animals, he joined the class of â€™17 at Texas A&M in College Station, where he received his Master of Science in Animal Science. With a focus on improving management of natural resources, Ira is pursuing his passion, exploring the nexus between plant growth and animal production utilizing multiple layers of remote sensing technology. By gaining a better understanding of grazing ecology as it relates to domesticated livestock, Ira hopes to generate excitement for science while providing tools to land and resource managers to farther improve environmental stewardship, wildlife management, agricultural production, and business profitability.
